intro: Gouania mauritiana subsp. aphrodes, commonly known as the Mauritius gouania, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
